org.jaudiolibs.jnajack
Class Jack

java.lang.Object
  org.jaudiolibs.jnajack.Jack

public class Jack
extends java.lang.Object

Main java wrapper to the Jack API. Loads the native library and provides methods for creating clients and querying the server. Most functions from the native Jack API that manipulate clients or ports can be found in JackClient and JackPort. This class is a singleton. Use Jack.getInstance()

Method Detail

openClient

public JackClient openClient(java.lang.String name,
                             java.util.EnumSet<JackOptions> options,
                             java.util.EnumSet<JackStatus> status)
                      throws JackException
Open an external client session with a JACK server.

Parameters:
name - of at most getMaximumClientNameSize() characters. The name scope is local to each server. Unless forbidden by the JackUseExactName option, the server will modify this name to create a unique variant, if needed.
options - EnumSet containing required JackOptions.
status - EnumSet will be filled with JackStatus values from native call
Returns:
JackClient
Throws:
JackException - if client could not be opened. Check status set for reasons.

getPorts

@Deprecated
public java.lang.String[] getPorts(java.lang.String regex,
                                              JackPortType type,
                                              java.util.EnumSet<JackPortFlags> flags)
                            throws JackException
Deprecated. 

Get an array of port names that match the requested criteria.

Parameters:
regex - A regular expression to match against the port names. If null or of zero length then no filtering will be done.
type - A JackPortType to filter results by. If null, the results will not be filtered by type.
flags - A set of JackPortFlags to filter results by. If the set is empty or null then the results will not be filtered.
Returns:
String[] of full port names.
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException
JackException

getPorts

                                   java.lang.String regex,
                                   JackPortType type,
                                   java.util.EnumSet<JackPortFlags> flags)
                            throws JackException
Get an array of port names that match the requested criteria.

Parameters:
client - A currently open client
regex - A regular expression to match against the port names. If null or of zero length then no filtering will be done.
type - A JackPortType to filter results by. If null, the results will not be filtered by type.
flags - A set of JackPortFlags to filter results by. If the set is empty or null then the results will not be filtered.
Returns:
String[] of full port names.
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException
JackException

connect

@Deprecated
public void connect(java.lang.String source,
                               java.lang.String destination)
             throws JackException
Deprecated. 

Establish a connection between two ports. When a connection exists, data written to the source port will be available to be read at the destination port. The port types must be identical. The JackPortFlags of the source port must include JackPortIsOutput. The JackPortFlags of the destination port must include JackPortIsInput.

Parameters:
source -
destination -
Throws:
JackException

connect

public void connect(JackClient client,
                    java.lang.String source,
                    java.lang.String destination)
             throws JackException
Establish a connection between two ports. When a connection exists, data written to the source port will be available to be read at the destination port. The port types must be identical. The JackPortFlags of the source port must include JackPortIsOutput. The JackPortFlags of the destination port must include JackPortIsInput.

Parameters:
client -
source - - output port
destination - - input port
Throws:
JackException

Returns:

getMaximumPortNameSize

public int getMaximumPortNameSize()
                           throws JackException
Get the maximum number of characters allowed in a JACK port name. This is the full port name, prefixed by "client_name:".

Returns:
maximum number of characters.
Throws:
JackException

getTime

public long getTime()
             throws JackException
return JACK's current system time in microseconds using JACK clock source. The value returned is guaranteed to be monotonic, but not linear.

Returns:
time
Throws:
JackException

getAllConnections

public java.lang.String[] getAllConnections(JackClient client,
                                            java.lang.String fullPortName)
                                     throws JackException
An array of full port names to which the supplied port is connected. If none, returns an empty array. This differs from JackPort.getConnections() in two important respects: 1) You may not call this function from code that is executed in response to a JACK event. For example, you cannot use it in a GraphReordered handler. 2) You need not be the owner of the port to get information about its connections.

Parameters:
client - Any valid JackClient, not necessarily the owner of the Port.
fullPortName - The full name of the port i.e. client:port
Returns:
Throws:
JackException
Since:
Jul 22, 2012

                        throws JackException

Returns:
Jack
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException - if native library cannot be loaded.
JackException
